alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Arapahoe, northeastern Denver and western Adams Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado 5 miles east of D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, or 21 miles northeast of Denver, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Denver, northern Aurora, eastern Commerce City, Denver International Airport and D.I.A Terminal and Concourses. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
